data.event: As of 2010, the population of Meridian was 75,092, and a 2014 estimate placed the population at approximately 85,000.
The town was established in 1891 on the Onweiler farm north of the present site and was called Hunter.

event.title: Two years later an I.O.O.F. lodge was organized and called

data.event: Two years later an I.O.O.F. lodge was organized and called itself Meridian because it was located on the Boise Meridian and the town was renamed.
The Settlers' Irrigation Ditch, 1892, changed the arid region into a productive farming community which was incorporated in 1902.
The Settlers' Irrigation Ditch, 1892, changed the arid region into a productive farming community which was incorporated in 1902.
